content.html:
↳ In-reply-to ¬ª can this be private

@eaplmx Actually that could work quite well. We could try that model to see how feasible it might be?

↳ In-reply-to ¬ª One use case is I would like to use yarn as a substitute for location checkins (i have a telegram bot which I share a location with that gets an image from google maps and posts the venue name with it). I use this to track places I've visited and rather have it private. I get the limitations of the protocol would prevent this.

@dendiz I think you should look at our sister project called Salty.im ‚Äì This is an instant messaging protocol based on Twtxt and uses e2e encryption so things are very private and secure. This might be better suited to your needs here‚Ä¶ Which has a lot of similarities to Yarn.social üòÖ

↳ In-reply-to ¬ª Who's coming to our weekly Yarn.social call / meetup today? 5am UTC at https://meet.jit.si/Yarn.social

@eaplmx Oh ü§¶‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è

↳ In-reply-to ¬ª Goryon feature requests! - edit - some kind of "you've read up to here" marker - hide the conversation hash and show some way to get to the yarn

@eaplmx I think we can just provide all variants of the content; We already do anyway. We provide the original twt content and markdown, so no reason we can‚Äôt add some additional cycles on the server-side / api-side and just do the rendering‚Ä¶

content.html:
↳ In-reply-to ¬ª üëã Does anyone from my pod mind if I shadow ban all reddit_.* feeds coming from @dendiz's pod (yarn.dendiz.xyz)? This will filter them out of my pod's Discover view. I want to do this for two reasons:

@dendiz I think its probably fine to just add the option to ‚Äúdeclare‚Äù a FeedType on User Accounts on pods and Feeds (personas) ‚Äì And just let the community deal with this. I I add this feature today/tomorrow for example, would you update your feeds appropriately? üòÖ It would basically mean I can remove the ‚Äúshadow ban‚Äù (on my pod) and let the software deal with the ‚Äúcategorisation‚Äù automatically.

↳ In-reply-to ¬ª üëã Does anyone from my pod mind if I shadow ban all reddit_.* feeds coming from @dendiz's pod (yarn.dendiz.xyz)? This will filter them out of my pod's Discover view. I want to do this for two reasons:

@dendiz Ahh no need to stop your script(s) ‚Äì I already shadow banned them for my pod, as it was cluttering up my pod‚Äôs ‚ÄúDiscover‚Äù view üòÖ ‚Äì So‚Ä¶ If these are just ‚Äúreal‚Äù user accounts on your Pod and you‚Äôre just scripting (via Python) against the API I think this is fine. I can only see one way out of this mess in terms of automating the process, that is to add a User Setting / Fee Setting that lets you define the type of feed, one of (currently) rss or bot. Does this sound reasonable to you? The only problem I see though is I can see this happening again due to lack of documentation or just whatever, so I‚Äôm kind of wondering how to make the process of ‚Äúautomated feeds‚Äù even easier and more obvious without cluttering up views intended not to have bots and automated feeds? ü§î

↳ In-reply-to ¬ª Goryon feature requests! - edit - some kind of "you've read up to here" marker - hide the conversation hash and show some way to get to the yarn

@justamoment I think I agree with you. And by ‚Äúpre-compiled‚Äù do you mean just hand API clients the HTML they should render and do all the rendering work server-side anyway and reuse all the same logic? (I also think this is better for consistency‚Äôs sake)

↳ In-reply-to ¬ª what services should i add to ~vern im bored

@aryak Congrats ü•≥

↳ In-reply-to ¬ª üëã Does anyone from my pod mind if I shadow ban all reddit_.* feeds coming from @dendiz's pod (yarn.dendiz.xyz)? This will filter them out of my pod's Discover view. I want to do this for two reasons:

@dendiz Unfoetunately you can‚Äôt set Feed Type on personas (yet) but we should probably add that‚Ä¶

How are you generating these posts now?

↳ In-reply-to ¬ª can this be private

@dendiz So this is a bit tricky. Yarn.social is based on Twtxt. Therefore feeds are expected to be published and hosted on public servers of some kind (supported are Gopher, Gemini and HTTP).

The only way to be private / invisible is blacklist the world and be dark or password protect feeds.

I have to ask though‚Ä¶ What is your use-case here? What are you trying to solve? ü§î

We have toyed with the idea of encrypted feeds but it hasn‚Äôt taken off so far‚Ä¶

can this be private

@dendiz So this is a bit tricky. Yarn.social is based on Twtxt. Therefore feeds are expected to be published and hosted on public servers of some kind (supported are Gopher, Gemini and HTTP).
The only way to be private / invisible is blacklist the world and be dark or password protect feeds.
I have to ask though‚Ä¶ What is your use-case here? What are you trying to solve? ü§î
We have toyed with the idea of encrypted feeds but it hasn‚Äôt taken off so far‚Ä¶
